## A statement of the overall goal / research question

The goal of our research will be to identify the academic and social factors that lead to alcoholism in teenagers. We will then construct a model to identify the likelihood of teenagers to suffer from alcoholism.

# Hello World

```{r load_data}
student_por <- read.csv("../data/student-por.csv")

ncol(student_por)

student_por <- student_por %>% mutate(Talc=(2/7*(Walc)+5/7*(Dalc)))

```

```{r EDA_Aamir}

student_por %>% group_by(sex) %>% summarise(mean=mean(Talc))

student_por %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x=Talc, y=health)) +
  geom_jitter() + geom_smooth()

student_por %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x=Medu, y=Talc)) + 
  geom_jitter() + 
  geom_smooth()

student_por %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x=Fedu, y=Talc)) + 
  geom_jitter() + 
  geom_smooth()
  
student_por %>%
  ggplot(aes(x=Talc, fill=sex)) +
  geom_histogram(binwidth = .25)

student_por %>%
  ggplot(aes(x=age, y=Talc)) +
  geom_jitter() +
  geom_smooth()

student_por %>%
  group_by(Mjob) %>%
  summarise(mean=mean(Talc))

student_por %>%
  group_by(Fjob) %>%
  summarise(mean=mean(Talc))

```
```{r linear_reg}
lin_model <- linear_reg() %>%
  set_engine("lm") %>%
  fit(Talc ~ school +
        sex +
        age + 
        address + 
        famsize + 
        Pstatus + 
        Medu +
        Fedu +
        Mjob + 
        Fjob + 
        reason +
        guardian +
        traveltime +
        studytime +
        failures +
        schoolsup +
        famsup +
        paid +
        activities +
        nursery +
        higher +
        internet +
        romantic +
        famrel +
        freetime +
        goout +
        health +
        absences, data = student_por)

line_tidy <- tidy(lin_model) %>% 
  filter(p.value < 0.05)

line_tidy
```
```{r new_model}
lin_model2 <- linear_reg() %>%
  set_engine("lm") %>%
  fit(Talc ~ school +
        age + 
        failures + 
        freetime + 
        sex +
        Fjob + 
        Mjob +
        reason + 
        studytime +
        famsup +
        goout +
        health +
        absences, data = student_por)
```




```{r resid}
aug <- augment(lin_model2$fit)

aug %>%
  ggplot(mapping = aes(x = .fitted, y = .resid)) +
  geom_jitter() + 
  geom_hline(yintercept = 0)
```
Note limitation - prediction confidence may be too low, std error artificially low


Visualizing school

```{r school, eval = TRUE}
student_por_school <- student_por %>% 
  select(school, Talc) %>% 
  group_by(school) %>%
  summarise(average_talc = mean(Talc))


student_por_school %>%
  ggplot(mapping = aes(x = school, y = average_talc)) +
  geom_col() +
  labs(
    title = "Average Total Alcohol Consumption By School", 
    x = "School", 
    y = "Average Total Alcohol Consumption"
  )

```

There does not appear to be a siginificant difference between schools.

Visualizing Sex

```{r sex, eval = TRUE}
student_por_sex <- student_por %>%
```

Visualizing Parent's Cohabitation Status


Visualizing Father's Education

---
Visualizing Mother's Job

```{r Mjob, eval = TRUE}
student_por_Mjob <- student_por %>% 
  select(Mjob, Talc) %>% 
  group_by(Mjob) %>%
  summarise(average_talc = mean(Talc))


student_por_Mjob %>%
  ggplot(mapping = aes(x = Mjob, y = average_talc)) +
  geom_col() +
  labs(
    title = "Average Total Alcohol Consumption By Mother's Job", 
    x = "Mother's Job", 
    y = "Average Total Alcohol Consumption"
  )
```
High schoolers with mothers who work in health care have the lowest average alcohol consumption, while those with mothers who work in civil services have the highest. 

---
Visualizing Father's Job

```{r Fjob, eval = TRUE}
student_por_Fjob <- student_por %>% 
  select(Fjob, Talc) %>% 
  group_by(Fjob) %>%
  summarise(average_talc = mean(Talc))

  ggplot(mapping = aes(x = Fjob, y = average_talc)) +
  geom_col() +
  labs(
    title = "Average Total Alcohol Consumption By Father's Job", 
    x = "Father's Job", 
    y = "Average Total Alcohol Consumption"
  )
```
High schoolers whose fathers are teachers have the lowest total alcohol consumption while those with fathers in civil service jobs have the highest. 

---
Visualizing Reason Job

```{r reason, eval = TRUE}
student_por_reason <- student_por %>% 
  select(reason, Talc) %>% 
  group_by(reason) %>%
  summarise(average_talc = mean(Talc))


student_por_reason %>%
  ggplot(mapping = aes(x = reason, y = average_talc)) +
  geom_col() +
  labs(
    title = "Average Total Alcohol Consumption By Reason for Joining School", 
    x = "Reason", 
    y = "Average Total Alcohol Consumption"
  )
```
High schoolers who choose their school based on reputation have the lowest total alohol consumption while those who choose for reasons besides courses, closeness to home, and reputation, have the highest.
